text: Brickellia wendtii is a North American species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It is native to northern Mexico in the state of Coahuila.Turner, B. L. 1997. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 1 – Eupatorieae. Phytologia Memoirs 11: i–iv, 1–272 Brickellia wendtii is a subshrub up to 100 cm (39 inches) tall. It has numerous small flower heads with cream-colored or pale green flowers.Turner, Billie Lee 1990. Phytologia 68: 90-92 diagnosis in Latin, description and commentary in English, line drawing on page 91 The species is named for US botanist Thomas Leighton Wendt (1950-).Tom Wendt ==References== wendtii Category:Flora of Coahuila Category:Plants described in 1990
